glossary.definition: A structured learning path consisting of multiple courses and resources
A specific learning unit with defined content and objectives
Learning material such as videos, documents, assessments, or interactive content
External organization or vendor that provides training content or services
Person who delivers training, either internal employee or external trainer

business_rules: Training programs must have defined structure and learning objectives
Courses must be associated with at least one training program
Resources must be linked to courses or programs
Training providers must be registered before their content can be used
Instructors must be assigned to courses that require live instruction
Program phases must be completed in sequence
Content versioning must be maintained for updates
Training catalog must be searchable and filterable
Programs can be mandatory or optional based on role or department
calculations_or_formulas: Course duration = sum of all resource durations
invariants: Training program must have at least one course
Course must have at least one resource or instructor
Resource must be associated with valid course or program
Instructor must be assigned to courses requiring instruction
Program structure must be valid (phases in order, no circular dependencies)
edge_cases: Training program is updated while participants are enrolled - system versions program, maintains participant progress in original version
Course resource is removed - system handles enrolled participants, may require alternative resource or course modification
Instructor becomes unavailable - system allows reassignment or rescheduling of instructor-led sessions
Training provider contract expires - system flags content, may restrict access or require renewal
Resource content is updated - system versions resource, maintains access to previous version for in-progress participants
Program structure is modified - system handles enrolled participants, may require migration or completion of original structure
Course prerequisite is not met - system blocks enrollment, shows prerequisite requirements
Training catalog search returns no results - system provides suggestions or filters
compliance_requirements: Training content must comply with company policies and legal requirements
Training records must be retained for compliance and audit purposes
Instructor qualifications must be documented and verified
Training provider contracts must be maintained and tracked
Content licensing and copyright must be respected
user_journeys: HR creates training program - defines structure, courses, and resources, program is available in catalog
Employee browses training catalog - searches and filters programs, views program details and requirements
Instructor is assigned to course - instructor receives notification, course is marked as instructor-led
Training resource is updated - new version is created, enrolled participants are notified
Training provider is registered - provider information is stored, their content becomes available
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given training program creation, when structure and courses are defined, then program is created and available in catalog
Given course enrollment, when prerequisites are met, then enrollment is successful and participant is notified
Given resource update, when new version is created, then version is tracked and participants are notified
Given instructor assignment, when instructor is available, then assignment is created and instructor is notified
Given training catalog search, when criteria are provided, then matching programs are returned and displayed
open_questions: What are the specific training program types? (mandatory? optional? role-based?)
How are course prerequisites enforced? (automatic blocking? warnings? recommendations?)
What is the resource versioning strategy? (maintain all versions? migrate participants?)
How are instructor qualifications validated? (certifications? experience? internal approval?)
What is the training provider relationship model? (contract-based? content licensing?)
How are training programs customized per department or role?
assumptions: Training programs consist of courses and resources
Courses can be self-paced or instructor-led
Resources can be various types (video, document, assessment, interactive)
Instructors can be internal employees or external trainers
